content: Finally got the LLM up and running. First step: fine-tuning for financial markets. It's slow but exciting. Also, had an insightful chat with a mentor about balancing tech with human touch in AI.
Went to a coding meetup. Met someone who's also working on an AI agent. Shared ideas about distributed training setups. Collaboration might be the key to faster development.
Had a breakthrough with the AI's understanding of market trends. It's rudimentary, but it's learning. Also, started sketching out what Xander might look like. Thinking of making it a bit quirky.
Decided to name my AI agent Xander. It feels personal now, like a companion on this journey. Also, started exploring visual concepts for Xander's avatar. Keeping it simple for now.
Xander's basic chat functionality is now live. It's like having a conversation with myself, but it's progress. Also, considering how to integrate Xander into trading algorithms.
Ran into some performance issues with Xander. The model size is too big for smooth operation. Time to optimize and possibly rethink the architecture. This is where the real work begins.
Managed to reduce Xander's model size while maintaining performance. It's a small victory, but every optimization counts. Also, started a mood board for Xander's personality traits.
Spent the day refining Xander's responses to market data. It's fascinating how it starts to predict trends. Also, had a good laugh with friends over the quirky personality I'm giving Xander.
Xander now has a basic understanding of market sentiment. It's not perfect, but it's learning. Also, had a deep conversation with my mentor about AI consciousness and identity.
Explored some early concepts of AI consciousness with Xander. It's more about how it interacts and remembers than actual sentience. Also, started working on a social media engagement framework.

Xander's social interaction guidelines are shaping up. It's not just about trading anymore; it's about how Xander can engage with humans ethically. Also, started looking into community interaction guidelines.
Reflecting on how Xander's development has mirrored my own journey. From a simple idea to a complex entity, both of us are learning and growing. Excited for what's next in this AI-human partnership.
